target: On the other hand, the Tang Dynasty continued the Sui Dynasty's reform of the Zhongzheng system, in which the emperor personally presided over the selection of scholars to participate in the irregular system of the court. From then on, the scholars who entered the service in the Tang Dynasty and later, once again showed the phenomenon of being both literate and military, and becoming generals and prime ministers. From the middle to late Tang Dynasty, the revival of the "scholar" tradition of both civil and military examinations was seen in the Confucian scholar class who entered the service.
